summary: Brackets are tall punctuation marks used to separate text or data. They come in four main pairs: parentheses ( ), square brackets [ ], curly braces { }, and angle brackets < >. In British English, "brackets" usually refers to parentheses, while in American English, it means square brackets. Brackets are often used in pairs to enclose or group related information, and they can be nested inside each other. In math, different brackets have specific meanings for functions and formulas.
title: Bracket
